author: Atticus Lish
title: ‘Patriot Number One’ Review: Exile on Main Street
text:
Zhuang Liehongcomes from Wukan, a Chinese fishing village about 50 miles from the special economic zone of Shenzhen, an epicenter of the historic transformation that has improved the lives of so many Chinese citizens while leaving others like Zhuang behind. One day in 2009—he was then in his late 20s, cadging an insecure living by delivering cigarettes and liquor with a moped—almost unwittingly, he started a protest movement targeting corrupt local officials who were illegally selling public land to real-estate developers for private gain.
In...
